result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.
Same conditions as probation, except for condition time.
3 YEARS suspension of driver privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $600.00 during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period probation.  If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Restitution set at ZERO.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
No contact with the victim Steven F.

Cooperate with agent.
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment.
Random urine and breath testing with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: to run consecutive to any other sentence,  at the DAY REPORTING CENTER with Huber privileges for treatment ONLY. Court will grant good time credit. Court DENIED the request for electronic monitoring.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Ramirez

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration OR Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED this sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:  
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period probation.  If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine and breath testing with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Pay fine of $600.00 during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison wages with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with the victim Steven F.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons at any time in the future.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participated in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.
*  3 YEARS suspension of driver privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  3 YEARS Ignition Interlock Device.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS, to run consecutive to any other sentence,  at the DAY REPORTING CENTER with Huber privileges for treatment ONLY. Court will grant good time credit. Court DENIED the request for electronic monitoring.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  1 Letter from the Wisconsin Lutheran Institutional Ministries Inc.

Defendant Juan Ramirez in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Juan Ramirez in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Juan Ramirez not in court, in custody.  
Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Juan Ramirez not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defendant has probation hold.  Defense request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Ramirez in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Juan Ramirez in custody.  Megan Carmody for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Juan Ramirez in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Juan Ramirez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
